definition: to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: I promised to attend the show.
sentences.chinese: 我答應去觀看文藝演出。

sentences.english: Sometimes performances are given in the hotel.
sentences.chinese: 飯店裏有時有文藝演出。

sentences.english: Performances of art reproduced in the form of long Gucha Changning culture.
sentences.chinese: 文藝演出以藝術的形式再現了昌寧悠久的古茶文化。

sentences.english: Nixon went onto the stage to meet the performance after watching their performances.
sentences.chinese: 尼克松觀看文藝演出後走上舞臺看望演員。

definition: lit. dragon soaring and tiger leaping (idiom)/fig. prosperous and bustling/vigorous and active
opera highlights performed as independent pieces
to start sth new or original (idiom); to break a new path/to break fresh ground
everyone present applauds/universal acclaim/a standing ovation/to bring the house down
CCTV New Year's Gala, Chinese New Year special/abbr. to 春晚[Chun1 Wan3]
pinyin: Chun1 jie2 Lian2 huan1 Wan3 hui4

definition: to do with the masses/mass (meeting, movement etc)
